### Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network – Marten River

#### Solicitation Information

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal

**Notice Type (Français):** Demande de Propositions

**Solicitation Number:** 5000077336 (EN), 5000077336 (FR)

**Procurement Category:** SRV (Service)

**Contracting Entity:**
Environment and Climate Change Canada

**Contact Information:**

James Molinski
Email: [james.molinski@ec.gc.ca](mailto:james.molinski@ec.gc.ca)
Phone: (819) 975-1856
Address: 351 boul. St-Joseph, Gatineau, QC, K1A 0H3

#### Tender Description (EN)

Environment and Climate Change Canada requires a contractor for daily technical support at the Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network (CAPMoN) Marten River site. The site, located in Ontario, is equipped with automated and manual samplers to collect precipitation and air samples. As the primary focus of the monitoring station, the contractor will be responsible for retrieving and processing the samples according to the Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). The samples will be packaged and shipped for analysis to the CAPMoN National Laboratory located in Toronto, Ontario.

#### Details of Work to be Performed

The contractor will be responsible for performing daily duties such as:

* Retrieving and processing precipitation and air samples in accordance with SOPs
* Reading and recording various gauges, diagnostics, and regular servicing, troubleshooting, and minor repair of monitoring equipment
* Attending to the station for daily operations (7 days per week, 52 weeks per year)
* Maintaining accurate records of sampling, shipping, and maintenance activities

The contractor will be provided with on-site training by ECCC technical staff. All work will be performed in accordance with the Site Operations Reference Manuals and any amendments to the manuals.

#### Tender Evaluation Criteria

The selection of the contractor will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

#### Tendering Method

This tender is released under a competitive process, inviting open bidding.

#### Language of Tender

English and French are both official languages of Canada. Tenders must be submitted in one of these two languages. However, the.EC will accept tenders in both languages, but the English version will be considered the primary version.
